data.headline: S&P 500 rose 0.64%, Dow gained 0.48%, Nasdaq climbed 0.56%, and rate-sensitive Russell 2000 outperformed with a 1.92% jump.
bullets: January CPI came in cooler than expected at 0.2% m/m and 2.4% y/y, with core inflation at four-year lows, reinforcing disinflation trends.
Lower inflation and strong jobs data increased odds of more aggressive Fed rate cuts, driving Treasury yields lower.
Markets paused yesterday’s AI-driven tech selloff, with select growth names rebounding.
Rivian surged after announcing a deal with Volkswagen.
Applied Materials jumped approximately 11% on strong performance.
Tariff-exposed metals and steel stocks weakened amid trade concerns.
Despite today's rally, major indexes remain on track for weekly losses ahead of next week’s jobs data.
